1.japanese: しかし　シロクマ君

2.japanese: コピーロボットが発明されれば

3.japanese: こうしてカフェモカを飲みながら同時に
3.english: 0,0,0,,it could be drinking café mocha like this,

4.japanese: ラーメンも食べられるのにね
4.english: 0,0,0,,and you could be eating ramen at the same time.

5.speaker: Polar Bear
5.japanese: そんな使い道のためなら
5.english: 0,0,0,,If that's what it would be used for, 0,0,0,,I don't think it really needs to be invented.

6.speaker: polar bear
6.japanese: そうだ　ピザを焼いたんだよ
6.english: 0,0,0,,Oh, that's right. I was making pizza.

8.speaker: polar bear
8.japanese: キャラピザにしてみたんだ
8.english: 0,0,0,,I thought I'd make a character pizza.

12.speaker: polar bear
12.japanese: ね　笑ったように見えるでしょ
12.english: 0,0,0,,See? He looks like he's laughing. 0,0,0,,That's not all. If you fold it the other way...

13.speaker: polar bear
13.japanese: 悲しい顔に見えるでしょ

14.speaker: penguin
14.japanese: ピザにいるかな　その機能
14.english: 0,0,0,,I wonder if that ability is really needed for a pizza.

16.speaker: penguin
16.japanese: 先輩は　ピザ向けのキャラじゃないね
16.english: 0,0,0,,He's not the kind of guy you put on a pizza.

17.speaker: penguin
17.japanese: 笹子さん カフェモカおかわりもらおうかな
17.english: 0,0,0,,Could I get another café mocha, Miss Sasako?

21.speaker: sasako
21.japanese: いらっしゃい　パンダ君

23.speaker: penguin
23.japanese: やあ パンダ君　よかったらピザどうぞ

24.speaker: panda
24.japanese: ううん　いらない 一生恩に着せられるから
24.english: 0,0,0,,Nope. Don't want it. 0,0,0,,You'll demand gratitude back forever.

25.speaker: penguin
25.japanese: 僕　そんなにせこい男じゃないよ

26.speaker: penguin
26.japanese: ひょっとしたら着せるかもしれないけど

27.speaker: sasako
27.japanese: 着せるんじゃないですか
27.english: 0,0,0,,So you are going to demand some...

28.speaker: penguin
28.japanese: というか　シロクマ君からだよ

31.speaker: penguin
31.japanese: ところで　シロクマ君

32.speaker: penguin
32.japanese: 最近ロングブレスダイエット始めたんだけどさ

34.speaker: polar bear
34.japanese: 仕事中だから　あとでいいかな
34.english: 0,0,0,,I'm working right now, so could we talk about this later?

35.speaker: penguin
35.japanese: 笹子さん　街角のポケットティッシュを
35.english: 0,0,0,,Miss Sasako, I thought of a good way of

36.japanese: 人より多くもらう方法を考えたんだけどさ
36.english: 0,0,0,,getting more pocket tissue hand-outs than anyone else.

37.speaker: penguin
37.japanese: あっ　シロクマ君　カフェモカおかわり
37.english: 0,0,0,,Oh, could I get another café mocha, Polar Bear?

38.speaker: penguin
38.japanese: しかしさ 卵かけごはんっておいしいよね
38.english: 0,0,0,,But you know, 0,0,0,,isn't raw egg over rice delicious?

39.speaker: penguin
39.japanese: 僕　卵かけごはんのおいしさなら
39.english: 0,0,0,,I could talk about its deliciousness all night.

40.speaker: penguin
40.japanese: あっ　そろそろ腹話術の稽古の時間だから行くよ
40.english: 0,0,0,,Oh, it's about time 0,0,0,,for my ventriloquism classes, so I'm gonna take off.

41.speaker: penguin
41.japanese: じゃあね　パンダ君

44.speaker: sasako
44.japanese: ありがとうございました

45.speaker: panda
45.japanese: ペンギンさんて　何なんだろう
45.english: 0,0,0,,I wonder what's up with Mr. Penguin...

46.speaker: sasako
46.japanese: えっ　どういうこと
46.english: 0,0,0,,Huh? What do you mean? 0,0,0,,Mr. Penguin is always at the café, talking, right?

48.speaker: panda
48.japanese: ペンギンさんて ふだん何してるんだろう
48.english: 0,0,0,,I wonder what he does when he's not here.

50.speaker: polar bear
50.japanese: 普通に無職かと思ってた
50.english: 0,0,0,,I always just thought he was unemployed.

51.speaker: sasako
51.japanese: けど　毎日カフェに来たりいつも遊んでますよね
51.english: 0,0,0,,But he comes to the café daily, and is always out having fun, right?

52.speaker: panda
52.japanese: どうやってイスに上るんだろう
52.english: 0,0,0,,I wonder how he gets onto the chair...

53.speaker: panda
53.japanese: 何の仕事してるんだろう
53.english: 0,0,0,,I wonder what kind of job he has...

54.speaker: panda
54.japanese: どこに住んでるんだろう

55.speaker: polar bear
55.japanese: あまり詮索しないほうがいいんじゃない
55.english: 0,0,0,,You probably shouldn't pry into it too much.

57.speaker: polar bear
57.japanese: カメラがあれば　いいかな

58.speaker: sasako
58.japanese: 詮索させるんじゃないですか
58.english: 0,0,0,,So you are going to have him investigate...

61.speaker: panda
61.japanese: 僕　明日から　ペンギンさんのすべてを暴いてみせるよ
61.english: 0,0,0,,Starting tomorrow, I'm going to expose everything about Mr. Penguin!

62.speaker: sasako
62.japanese: 言葉が間違ってるんじゃないかな
62.english: 0,0,0,,I think you may be using the wrong word there. 0,0,0,,Polar Bear's Café

63.speaker: penguin
63.japanese: だから　僕言ってやったんだよ

64.speaker: penguin
64.japanese: それはポイントつかないんですかって

66.speaker: penguin
66.japanese: は　しゃべり疲れたよ

71.speaker: polar bear
71.japanese: ペンギンさんの弱み　握ってきて
71.english: 0,0,0,,Be sure to find out some of his weaknesses.

72.speaker: sasako
72.japanese: 目的が違ってきてるんじゃないでしょうか
72.english: 0,0,0,,I think your intention is gradually changing... 0,0,0,,Polar Bear's Café

74.speaker: penguin
74.japanese: 「このカフェにたどり着いたラッキーボーイズアンガールズ」
74.english: 0,0,0,,To the lucky boys and girls that stumbled upon this café

75.speaker: penguin
75.japanese: 「とびきりのメニューでおもてなし」
75.english: 0,0,0,,We welcome you with an amazing menu

76.speaker: penguin
76.japanese: 「オー・ジャス・フォー　ユウ」

77.speaker: anteater
77.japanese: ペンギンさん　最高

78.speaker: panda
78.japanese: コアリクイ君とお酒飲んでるんだ
78.english: 0,0,0,,So he's drinking with Anteater... 0,0,0,,{\a6}One more time, one more time!

79.speaker: lady
79.japanese: ちょっと パンダさん

80.speaker: penguin bg
80.japanese: ちょっと パンダさん
80.english: 0,0,0,,{\a6}Oh, that's awesome! 0,0,0,,{\a6}One more time, one more time!

81.speaker: lady
81.english: 0,0,0,,You're sort of in the way. 0,0,0,,That's awesome!

82.speaker: anteater
82.english: 0,0,0,,Hey, Pops, can we get some mozuku seaweed?

83.speaker: pops
83.japanese: アリじゃなくていいの
83.english: 0,0,0,,You sure you don't want any ants?

84.speaker: anteater
84.japanese: 酔ってたら全部ありだよ

85.speaker: penguin
85.japanese: いいね　コアリクイ君 そうこなくっちゃ
85.english: 0,0,0,,That was great, Anteater! You got that right!

86.speaker: anteater
86.japanese: いや　アリなんて食べてらんないよ
86.english: 0,0,0,,You can't just eat ants all the time...

87.speaker: panda
87.japanese: コアリクイ君は　酔うとなんでも食べられるんだ
87.english: 0,0,0,,So Anteater can eat anything when he's drunk.

89.speaker: lady
89.japanese: かわいいからしようがないか
89.english: 0,0,0,,He's cute, so I guess it's okay.

92.speaker: sloth
92.japanese: なんでボールペンで書いちゃうの
92.english: 0,0,0,,Why'd you write that with a pen?

93.speaker: sloth
93.japanese: ちょっと消えないでしょ　それ
93.english: 0,0,0,,Come on, it won't come off, then.

94.speaker: panda
94.japanese: 寝言は早くしゃべれるんだ
94.english: 0,0,0,,Apparently he can speak faster in his sleep...

99.speaker: polar bear
99.japanese: 見失っちゃったんだね

101.speaker: polar bear
101.japanese: これを食べてもらったらどうかな
101.english: 0,0,0,,Maybe we should have him eat these.

102.speaker: polar bear
102.japanese: ＧＰＳの発信機を中に入れておいたんだ
102.english: 0,0,0,,I snuck a GPS transmitter in them.

103.speaker: sasako
103.japanese: そこまでやらなくていいんじゃないですかね
103.english: 0,0,0,,I don't think you need to go that far...

104.speaker: panda
104.japanese: けど　ダラダラ過ごして楽しそうにしてるのはわかったよ
104.english: 0,0,0,,But I did find out that he lazes around and has fun. 0,0,0,,That's something we could have found out here.

105.speaker: sasako
105.japanese: でも　コアリクイさんって　酔うとなんでも食べられるんですね
105.english: 0,0,0,,But apparently Mr. Anteater can eat anything when he's drunk.

106.speaker: polar bear
106.japanese: ナマケモノ君が　寝言では早くしゃべれるのにも驚いたよ
106.english: 0,0,0,,I was surprised that Sloth could talk faster in his sleep, too.

108.speaker: polar bear
108.japanese: ペンギンさんの秘密より そっちがすごいよね
108.english: 0,0,0,,Those both are far better than Mr. Penguin's secrets.

109.speaker: panda
109.japanese: これ　リンリンに借りてきたよ

111.speaker: panda
111.japanese: 今日はペンギンさんがイスに上るところを

112.speaker: panda
112.japanese: ビデオで撮っておこうと思うんだ
112.english: 0,0,0,,getting on a chair on video today.

113.speaker: panda
113.japanese: いつも　いつの間にか座ってて どう上ってるかわからないから
113.english: 0,0,0,,He's always already on the chair, 0,0,0,,so I don't know how he gets on.

114.speaker: panda
114.japanese: 今日こそは　どうやって座ってるか見てみよう
114.english: 0,0,0,,So today, let's finally see how he does it.

116.speaker: penguin
116.japanese: やあもう　春のにおいがするね
116.english: 0,0,0,,Man, it sure smells like spring already.

117.speaker: penguin
117.japanese: そこで　ラマさんと会っちゃって
117.english: 0,0,0,,I ran into Mr. Llama over there.

120.speaker: sasako
120.japanese: パンダ君　笹おかわりどうする
120.english: 0,0,0,,Did you want another serving of bamboo grass, Panda?

122.speaker: penguin
122.english: 0,0,0,,I'll have a café mocha. 0,0,0,,And could I get a coffee?

123.speaker: panda
123.japanese: また　いつの間にか座ってる
123.english: 0,0,0,,And just like that, he's already sitting again...

124.speaker: panda
124.japanese: けど　ビデオに撮ってるから大丈夫
124.english: 0,0,0,,But it's on video, so that's not a problem.

125.speaker: panda
125.japanese: じゃあ　見てみよう

126.speaker: penguin
126.japanese: やあ もう春のにおいがするね
126.english: 0,0,0,,Man, it sure smells like spring already.

127.speaker: penguin
127.japanese: そこでラマさんと会っちゃって
127.english: 0,0,0,,I ran into Mr. Llama over there.

131.speaker: sasako
131.japanese: ラマさんってこうやって座ってるんですね
131.english: 0,0,0,,So that's how Mr. Llama gets onto a chair.

133.speaker: panda
133.japanese: でも　ペンギンさんのことは何もわからなかったよ
133.english: 0,0,0,,But we didn't find out anything about Mr. Penguin. 0,0,0,,Oh!

136.speaker: penguin
136.japanese: さて　そろそろ帰ろうかな
136.english: 0,0,0,,All right, I think I'll head home now.

139.speaker: panda
139.japanese: 脇に財布を挟んでるんだね
139.english: 0,0,0,,So he carries it under his flipper.

141.speaker: sasako
141.japanese: そういえば　最近　お財布買ったって言ってましたけど
141.english: 0,0,0,,Speaking of which, I think he mentioned buying a wallet recently.

142.speaker: polar bear
142.japanese: どちらにせよ　知っても知らなくてもいい秘密だったね
142.english: 0,0,0,,Either way, 0,0,0,,it was a secret we didn't really need to know about. 0,0,0,,Polar Bear's Café 0,0,0,,Polar Bear's Café

144.speaker: sasako
144.japanese: ペンギンさん　家を買うんですか
144.english: 0,0,0,,Are you going to buy a house, Mr. Penguin? 0,0,0,,I'm thinking about moving.

146.speaker: penguin
146.japanese: マンションの更新が近いからさ
146.english: 0,0,0,,The lease on my apartment runs out soon,

147.speaker: penguin
147.japanese: 思いきって引っ越してみようかなって

148.speaker: panda
148.japanese: ペンギンさんってマンションに住んでるんだね
148.english: 0,0,0,,So you live in an apartment, Mr. Penguin?

149.speaker: penguin
149.japanese: そうだよ　言ってなかった

150.speaker: panda
150.japanese: ペンギンだと　不動産屋さんで大変だったりしないの
150.english: 0,0,0,,Isn't it hard going to a real estate agent when you're a penguin?

152.speaker: sasako
152.japanese: ペンギンさん 引っ越しちゃうんですね
152.english: 0,0,0,,So, I guess Mr. Penguin is moving... 0,0,0,,Yes.

153.speaker: sasako
153.japanese: 寂しいですけど お別れのシーズンですからね
153.english: 0,0,0,,It'll be lonely, but I guess it is the season of goodbyes. 0,0,0,,Could you pick out some flowers for me?

154.speaker: creeper
154.japanese: どういった花をお探しで
154.english: 0,0,0,,What kind of flowers are you looking for?

156.speaker: wolf
156.japanese: あっ　シロクマさん

157.speaker: wolf
157.japanese: ロバさんの店で 初めてバケット焼かせてもらったんですよ
157.english: 0,0,0,,Ms. Donkey finally let me bake some baguettes for the first time.

158.speaker: wolf
158.japanese: よかったら　どうぞ

161.speaker: grizzly
161.japanese: そういやこの間　ペンギンが来たぜ
161.english: 0,0,0,,Oh yeah, Penguin stopped in the other day.

167.speaker: polar bear
167.japanese: アユのお菓子で作ってみたんだ

168.speaker: sasako
168.japanese: なんか　しゃちほこっぽいのが出てますけど
168.english: 0,0,0,,There seems to be something resembling a shachihoko sticking out...

171.speaker: sasako
171.japanese: もしかしてペンギンさんのためにですか

174.speaker: penguin
174.japanese: シロクマ君　キミ　ホントすごいね

177.speaker: polar bear
177.japanese: もし　飲みたくなったときはさ…
177.english: 0,0,0,,You know, if you ever want to drink it...

178.speaker: penguin
178.english: 0,0,0,,Oh, that's right. I renewed my lease. 0,0,0,,Eh?

179.speaker: sasako
179.japanese: 引っ越し　やめたんですか

180.speaker: penguin
180.japanese: めんどくさいんだもん 部屋探しって
180.english: 0,0,0,,It's too troublesome to find another place.

182.speaker: sasako
182.japanese: よかったですね　シロクマさん
182.english: 0,0,0,,That's great, isn't it, Mr. Polar Bear?

187.speaker: penguin
187.japanese: 気になるなぁ　もしかして
187.english: 0,0,0,,I totally want to know now. 0,0,0,,Oh, did you discover the best time to spit out gum after it loses its flavor?

195.speaker: penguin
195.japanese: 今年も　きれいに咲いたね

196.speaker: penguin
196.japanese: 毎年　言ってる気がするけど
196.english: 0,0,0,,Though I think I say that every year.

198.speaker: penguin
198.japanese: 早いもんだね パンダ君や笹子さんと出会って
198.english: 0,0,0,,It sure goes by fast... 0,0,0,,It's already been a year

199.speaker: penguin
199.english: 0,0,0,,since we met Panda and Miss Sasako.

200.speaker: sasako
200.japanese: そうですね　もう １年なんですね

201.speaker: panda
201.japanese: この１年で　ペンギンさんのいろんな面を見たよ
201.english: 0,0,0,,We saw many different sides of Mr. Penguin this year.

202.speaker: penguin
202.japanese: もうちょっといい場面思い出してくれないかな
202.english: 0,0,0,,Could you remember something a little better than that? 0,0,0,,Hey!

203.speaker: grizzly
203.english: 0,0,0,,We're gonna drink! It's cherry blossom viewing time!

205.speaker: polar bear
205.japanese: グリズリー君　いらっしゃい

206.speaker: penguin
206.japanese: よし　今日は飲もう

207.speaker: panda
207.japanese: よし　今日は笹　食べるよ
207.english: 0,0,0,,All right! I'm gonna eat bamboo grass today!

208.speaker: penguin
208.japanese: キミは　年がら年中　食べてるでしょ

209.speaker: llama
209.english: 0,0,0,,The cherry blossoms are magnificent. 0,0,0,,I bought... drinks...

210.speaker: polar bear
210.japanese: ありがとう さあ　座って　座って
210.english: 0,0,0,,Thanks. All right, everyone have a seat.

211.speaker: sasako
211.japanese: こんにちは　半田さん

212.speaker: sasako
212.japanese: この間はミカン ありがとうございました
212.english: 0,0,0,,Thank you for the mandarins the other day.

214.speaker: kirino
214.japanese: あっ　はじめまして 半田さんの後輩の桐野です
214.english: 0,0,0,,Oh, nice to meet you. 0,0,0,,My name is Kirino and I work under Mr. Handa.

215.speaker: kirino
215.japanese: 僕　しろくまカフェ初めて来ました
215.english: 0,0,0,,This is my first time coming to Polar Bear's Café.

216.speaker: sasako
216.japanese: そうですか　これからは遊びに来てくださいね

217.speaker: kirino
217.japanese: はい　もちろんです

218.speaker: sasako
218.japanese: ありがとうございます

219.speaker: kirino
219.japanese: これからは　ちょくちょく来るようにしますよ
219.english: 0,0,0,,I'll make sure I stop by often.

220.speaker: sasako
220.japanese: そうですか ありがとうございます

221.speaker: handa
221.japanese: た　たまにでいいんじゃないかな
221.english: 0,0,0,,I-I think once in a while would be better...

223.speaker: mama rs
223.japanese: マサキ　もっとチャキチャキ歩きなさいよ
223.english: 0,0,0,,Come on, Masaki, get a move on.

224.speaker: mama rs
224.japanese: コーヒー冷めちゃうわよ

227.speaker: masaki
227.japanese: 師匠と一緒に淹れた特製コーヒーっす
227.english: 0,0,0,,This is special coffee that Master and I made.

228.speaker: polar bear
228.japanese: うん　みんなで飲もう

231.speaker: ft panda
231.japanese: 久しぶりだね　パンダ君

232.speaker: panda
232.japanese: 向こうの動物園 クビになったの
232.english: 0,0,0,,Did you get fired from your new zoo?

233.speaker: ft panda
233.japanese: 違うよ　有給休暇とったんだよ

234.speaker: ft panda
234.japanese: パンダ君に会いたくてね

235.speaker: ft panda
235.english: 0,0,0,,I'll be back here for a week.

239.speaker: panda
239.japanese: シンガポールに行ってたのに 日焼けしてないんだね
239.english: 0,0,0,,You went to Singapore, 0,0,0,,but you didn't tan at all.

242.speaker: rin rin
242.japanese: ありがとうございます
242.english: 0,0,0,,Oh, thank you very much. 0,0,0,,I can die happy. 0,0,0,,I'm surrounded by pandas.

243.speaker: rin rin
243.japanese: と思ったら 半田さんじゃないですか

246.speaker: handa
246.japanese: な　なに　メイメイちゃん

247.speaker: mei mei
247.japanese: お花より　半さまを見てていいですか
247.english: 0,0,0,,Is it okay if I look at you, instead of the flowers?

248.speaker: mei mei hyper
248.japanese: キャー　恥ずかしい　言っちゃった

250.speaker: adelie
250.japanese: ペンカ　いかがっすか
250.english: 0,0,0,,Anyone want any penguin cards? 0,0,0,,Anyone want any penguin cards to go with flower viewing?

251.speaker: chinstrap
251.japanese: もう売れないから飲もう

253.speaker: penguin
253.japanese: 近い　近い　近い

254.speaker: llama
254.japanese: そんなに言うほど地味ですかね　僕

256.speaker: llama
256.english: 0,0,0,,Well, thank you... 0,0,0,,I'll keep you company... for years...

258.speaker: penguin
258.english: 0,0,0,,It's been a while, Miss Penko. 0,0,0,,I'm Penmi! 0,0,0,,I'm sorry... 0,0,0,,Oh, that's right, today...

259.speaker: penkos
259.japanese: 妹たちを連れて来たの

267.speaker: all
267.japanese: はじめまして　ペンギンさん
267.english: 0,0,0,,Nice to meet you, Mr. Penguin. 0,0,0,,N-Nice to meet you... 0,0,0,,Um...

268.speaker: penguin
268.japanese: ラマさん　あとは任せた
268.english: 0,0,0,,I leave the rest to you, Mr. Llama!

272.speaker: llama
272.japanese: お久しぶりで　すペン奈さんに　ペンニュエルさん
272.english: 0,0,0,,It's been a while, Miss Penna and Miss Pennuelle.

275.speaker: sasako
275.japanese: 飲みもの足りますかね
275.english: 0,0,0,,I wonder if we have enough drinks.

277.speaker: grizzly
277.japanese: 何やってんだ　早くこ～い
277.english: 0,0,0,,What the hell are you doin'? 0,0,0,,Hurry and get over here!

281.speaker: panda
281.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

287.speaker: panda
287.japanese: ペンギンさん　世界中の子供たちにありがたいひと言を聞かせてあげて
287.english: 0,0,0,,Mr. Penguin, please tell the children of the world 0,0,0,,something wise.

288.speaker: penguin
288.japanese: 割り勘するときのために

289.speaker: penguin
289.japanese: お酒は飲めるようになっていたほうがいいよ
289.english: 0,0,0,,for whenever you going to split the bill.

290.speaker: panda
290.japanese: こんなに　子供に伝える必要もない言葉もあるんだね
290.english: 0,0,0,,I don't think there's ever been something so useless to tell children.

291.speaker: sasako
291.japanese: シロクマさん　終わりましょう

292.speaker: polar bear
292.japanese: 来週のこの時間は『しろくまカフェ』第１話
292.english: 0,0,0,,Next week at this time, 0,0,0,,will be Polar Bear's Café episode 1.
